Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close(object varIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: An expression that specifies the position of a member of the . If a numeric expression, the argument must be a number from 0 to the value of the minus 1. If a string expression, the argument must be the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) path of a member of the collection.
Docs.summary: Closes the specified Microsoft InfoPath form.

remarks.para: The Close method closes the currently open form without quitting the InfoPath application. The form is closed unconditionally, meaning that any changes made to the data in the form are not saved.

Docs.summary: Gets a count of the number of objects contained in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection..

remarks.para: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(varIndex As Object) As XDocument

Docs.param: An expression that specifies the position of a member of the . If a numeric expression, the argument must be a number from 0 to the value of the minus 1. If a string expression, the argument must be the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) path of a member of the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the specified object from the collection.

remarks.para: If the value provided for the argument does not match any existing member of the collection, an error occurs.
After you have set a reference to the XDocument object that the Item property returns, you can access any of its properties or methods.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument New(object varURI, int32 dwBehavior) cil managed
Public Function New (varURI As Object, dwBehavior As Integer) As XDocument

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form.
Default value is 1. A value that specifies how the form should be opened. The values are based on the enumeration.
Docs.summary: Creates a new Microsoft InfoPath form based on the specified form.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the new form.

remarks.para: The New method can only be used to create a new form based on an existing form; it cannot be used to create a new form based on a form template. To create a form from a form template, use the method.
When you use the New method, the new form opens in InfoPath and is ready to be filled out.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument NewFromSolution(object varURI) cil managed
Public Function NewFromSolution (varURI As Object) As XDocument

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form.
Docs.summary: Creates a new Microsoft InfoPath form based on the specified form template.
Docs.returns: An that represents the new form.

remarks.para: The NewFromSolution method can only be used to create a new form based on an existing form template; it cannot be used to create a new form based on a form. To create a form from an existing form, use the method.
When you use the NewFromSolution method, the new form opens in InfoPath and is ready to be filled out.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument NewFromSolutionWithData (object varXMLData, object varSolutionURI, int dwBehavior);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument NewFromSolutionWithData(object varXMLData, object varSolutionURI, int32 dwBehavior) cil managed
Public Function NewFromSolutionWithData (varXMLData As Object, varSolutionURI As Object, dwBehavior As Integer) As XDocument
public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::InfoPath::SemiTrust::XDocument ^ NewFromSolutionWithData(System::Object ^ varXMLData, System::Object ^ varSolutionURI, int dwBehavior);
abstract member NewFromSolutionWithData : obj * obj * int -> Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument

Docs.param: Provides the XML data to be used as a template for the form. Can be a string that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of an XML document, or an XMLDOMNode that contains the XML to be used as the XML document (template).
Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form template file (an .xsf or .xsn file).
Reserved for future use. This value should be set to 1.
Docs.summary: Creates a new Microsoft InfoPath form using the specified XML data and form template.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the new form.

remarks.para: The following related methods of the XDocuments collection are also available:

item.description: The method enables creating a new instance of InfoPath by using a specified XML document. The XML document must correspond to an InfoPath form. A new form is opened in InfoPath, using the supplied XML document as initial data, and its associated form template as specified in the processing instructions in the header of the document.
The method enables creating a new instance of InfoPath using a specified form template, and its associated XML form (the initial template data).

remarks.para: The NewFromSolutionWithData method supports a scenario that is not provided by the foregoing two methods: specifying both the XML document used as initial data and the form template. The XML document does not need to have been created by InfoPath. It can be supplied either as a URI or as an XMLDOMNode.
When you use the NewFromSolutionWithData method, the new form opens in InfoPath and is ready to be filled out.
Important: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument NewFromSolutionWithInputParameters(object varSolutionURI, object varInputParams) cil managed
Public Function NewFromSolutionWithInputParameters (varSolutionURI As Object, varInputParams As Object) As XDocument

Docs.param: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the form template on which to base the new form.
One or more name/value pairs separated by the ampersand (&) character.
Docs.summary: Creates a new form using the specified form template with the specified form template and input parameters.
Docs.returns: An that represents the new form.

remarks.para: To use the input parameters passed to the parameter, the form specified in the parameter must contain a event handler that uses the property of the class to retrieve the input parameter values, and then do something with those values.

This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.XDocument Open(object varURI, int32 dwBehavior) cil managed
Public Function Open (varURI As Object, dwBehavior As Integer) As XDocument

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form.
Default value is 1. A value that specifies how the form should be opened. The values are based on the enumeration.
Docs.summary: Opens the specified Microsoft InfoPath form.
Docs.returns: An that represents the specified form.

remarks.para: The Open method can only be used to open a form; it cannot be used to open a form template. To create a form from a form template, use the method. To create a form based on an existing form, use the method.
When you use the Open method, the specified form opens in InfoPath and is ready to be filled out.
This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
